text:
I have solve this by adding `group_column_${index}` to `_website__footer_${index}`

from `_website__footer_${index}` to `group_column_${index}__website__footer_${index}`

Thanks to <@U083Z05GQSJ>

Hello <@UCY83QS6Q> and <@UDHT6N5SM>, saw that this is the latest thread that talks about local page proxy. :simple_smile:
I was wondering if you happened to try to setup a fresh project lately?

because Im currently setting up a fresh project based from the "hello-world" example project and as I was in <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react/tree/main/examples/hello-world#4-developing-locally|Step 4 - Developing Locally>
I cant proxy my sample Home Page.

I got this error in the terminal ( refer below ) after running `npm run start`
The `/check-if-local-dev-server` endpoint returns `{"hasJSBuildingBlocks":false}`

What Ive tried so far, is that we have an existing cms-react project which is the local proxy is still working.
I copied the whole project and remove all the node_module and re-install all the packages, and now I have the same error.

Which makes me conclude maybe, something is broken with the latest package or there is a new setting/configuration that I dont know.

I hope you can help me.
Maybe there is a work-around? a specific version we can use for now? or a new setting in HubSpot side or source code.
Thanks in advance!

Ok thank you:raised_hands: The second solution using HubDB sounds a little too wild for me. Sad theres no native way. We’ll try the native language switcher. It’s not possible to place it into a react module is it?:thinking_face:
